reference.title: WH: Software variables — Distech
reference.shortdesc: This Warehouse Topic includes keywords and phrases for use as variables. In other documents you can insert these via a keydefinition map (kd Map for Variables). We can ORGANIZE this list as it grows and it becomes more evident what things we are using as “variables”.

table.title: GENERAL SOFTWARE PRODUCT VARIABLES
table.desc: Primarily words or phrases to refer to software. These words should be referenced into topics every time they are used. This is in contrast to Terms that are defined the first time in a topic or section but not tagged on every usage. Also: do not put Hardware names, such as Host Models in here; they go in the WH: Hardware.The software variables have been reorganized to make things easier to find. There are separate tables now for logical groupings of variables. Get an overall picture using Document Map view and collapsing all tables. – Claire, 28Jul2017.

row.entry: EC-Net 4 Pro inside a text element so that it can be used inside the option element
Likely product name for Edge 10 ACE driver, new in N4.8
Identifies the version of FIPS currently supported by Niagara
Feature name for AX-on-Titan, new in AX-3.8U1
Official Feature name, new in AX-3.8U1
Product name (4.5 or later release date) — Distech usage of this is uncertain.
Product name for cloud Edge device (4.5 or later release date) — Distech usage of this is uncertain.
Niagara Framework, where “Niagara” is not entered as a separate keyword
Niagara Framework, where “Niagara” is not entered as a separate keyword and there is no registered trademark symbol; this does not refer to the Niagara Analytics Framework
Business name (can be used when referencing proprietary code developed by Tridium)
Lower case version of the corporate brand used for paths

Used for a term analogous to tridium.com/resources/library (corporate resources that are hosted on the corporate website. Can be used as variable when needed for OEM specific portal such as Distech’s SmartSource.)
Short name for Niagara Web Launcher
Product name. Try to use this for Product Naming only.
Product name Version 4. Use to make a distinction from AX
Product version 4.5 — CHANGED TO FIX ANY REFs POINTING TO 4.5 (THEY PROBABLY SHOULD BE 4.6)

Product name with Trademark. Use this version the first time that the term appears in a document. Niagara is NOT trademarked. That’s why no mark is here but OEMs may TM their version of this word in certain contexts. “Niagara Framework” is trademarked, as show right here.
Product name with TM. Only use first time product name is used in the document.

entry.b: TYPES OF N4 HOMES and INSTALLATION PATHS

row.entry: controller user home, daemon user home on a controller, niagara_user_home
platform daemon home (for niagara daemon on supervisor)
install path (Linux OS) Also linux system home
Product name for DGLogik’s visualization package that works with Niagara Analytics Framework
Niagara Analytics Framework name, short version without the article “the”. (Note: do not use “NAF”)

entry.note: Ensure that you refer to and adhere to the latest firewall rules and whitelisting documented in the . The latest pdf version of this document (FC-InternetConnectivity.pdf) can be downloaded from Forge Connect Documentation.

row.entry: Reusable note for Forge docs on referring to the firewall listing.

entry.note: Protect against unauthorized access by restricting physical access to the computers and devices that manage your building model. Set up user authentication with strong passwords, and secure components by controlling permissions. Failure to observe these recommended precautions could expose your network systems to unauthorized access and tampering.

entry.ph: This topic contains important information about the purpose, content, context, and intended audience for this document.

row.entry: Short description phrase that should be included in most, if not all “About this Document” short description elements. Does not need to be included in OEM WH variable lists but I put it here just in case...

entry.ph: This document is part of the technical documentation library. Released versions of software include a complete collection of technical information that is provided in both online help and PDF format. The information in this document is written primarily for Systems Integrators. In order to make the most of the information in this book, readers should have some training or previous experience with or software.

row.entry: Use this sentence in every document. This good information and at the same time fulfills the need for “first usage” of two trademarked terms.

entry.ph: This document is part of the technical documentation library. The information in this document is written primarily for engineers, electricians, technicians, or service persons who are performing system design, installation, or configurations. In order to make the most of the information in this book, readers should have some training or previous experience with or software, as well as experience working with network controllers.

row.entry: Use this sentence in appropriate Hardware documents.

entry.ph: This document is part of the technical documentation library. Released versions of software include a complete collection of technical information that is provided in PDF format. The information in these documents is written for users. To make the most of the information in this book, readers should have some knowledge of cloud-based building management services, as well as training or previous experience with , and experience working with network controllers.

row.entry: Use this sentence in every Forge Connect-related user document for internal and external users. This is good preface information and at the same time fulfills the need for “first usage” of some trademarked terms.

entry.ph: One or more of the following products may be used during this process: Arm® Pelion™, Canonical® Ubuntu®, Canonical® snapcraft®, , Honeywell Security Center, , Niagara Framework®, JACE®..

row.entry: This paragraph is used in the Document Content section in About this guide topics in Forge Connect docs. This is to satisfy trademark requirement for “first usage” of the terms.

entry.ph: This document is part of the technical documentation library. The information in this document is written primarily for engineers, electricians, technicians, or service persons who are performing system design, installation, or configurations. In order to make the most of the information in this book, readers should have some training or previous experience with or software, as well as experience working with JACE network controllers.

row.entry: Use this sentence in appropriate Hardware documents.

entry.ph: Components include services, folders and other model building blocks associated with a module. You drag them to a property or wire sheet from a palette. Views are plugins that can be accessed by double-clicking a component in the Nav tree or right-clicking a component and selecting its view from the Views menu.

row.entry: 30May2017 — Insert this phrase in the shortdesc for “Components and views” chapter.

entry.p:
The component and view topics that follow appear as context-sensitive help topics when accessed by:
Right-clicking on the object and selecting ViewsGuide Help
Clicking HelpGuide On Target

entry.ph: This topic contains a short description of a component or the component plugin view.

row.entry: 30May2017 — We no longer use the phrase in this row:

li.p: Standard theme that has look and feel common to other Distech Controls software products.
Zebra (shown below as theme 1 on the left)
This theme has a low contrast, grayscale coloring and is the default theme.
Lucid (shown below as theme 2 on the right)
Displays a blue and gray color scheme.

row.entry: For use specifically in Built-in themes topic in the Getting Started with N4 (User Guide)

entry.note:
The Weather Underground has discontinued free service as of December 31, 2018. This will impact those users who utilize a free Weather Underground key in conjunction with our WUnderground Provider. Once the service is discontinued, users can expect to see their weather reports highlighted as orange with stale data.
Alternative options to receive weather from other service providers are available. Note, the National Weather Service provider will continue to work for North America users.

entry.p: Due to changes in the Weather Underground service, a new weather provider type is available via “theWeatherCompany.jar” patch. The station’s host platform must have both the “weather” and “theWeatherCompany” modules installed. The Weather Company Provider provides all of the functionality formerly available as a free service from the Weather Underground. Check with your OEM distributor for availability.
For related details, see “theWeatherCompany-TheWeatherCompanyWeatherProvider” in the “Components” section of this guide.

row.entry: this Reusable note can be used in only the AX Weather Guide. Plus para with ref to component topic in AX guide

entry.p: Due to changes in the Weather Underground service, in a new weather provider type is available, providing that the station’s host platform has both the “weather” and “TheWeatherCompany” modules installed. The Weather Company Provider provides all of the functionality formerly available as a free service from the Weather Underground.
For related details, see “theWeatherCompany-TheWeatherCompanyWeatherProvider” in the “Components and Views” chapter of this guide.

row.entry: This reusable note can be used in only the N4 Weather Guide. Plus para with ref to component topic in N4 guide
The following reusable Niagara Cloud Services content

entry.p:
If your local network uses a proxy server to provide Internet access, work with your on-site IT department to configure the proxy server to allow access to the Niagara Cloud. The Niagara station requires unauthenticated proxy access to the following domains which are part of the Niagara Cloud ecosystem:
*.scm.azurewebsites.net
*.azurewebsites.net
*.cloud.tridium.com
*.tridium.com
*.dsentience.net
*.honeywell.com
*.force.com
*.niagara-community.com
*.trafficmanager.net
*.azure-devices.net

row.entry:
For use specifically in Niagara Cloud Backup as a Service Guide. This is a reusable paragraph on required proxy server settings.
Could possibly be used in the nCloud Driver Guide

entry.note: The type of memory being used by the tag rule and implied tag indexes is heap memory. So these indexes are not stored persistently but are built dynamically after every station reboot when NEQL queries are submitted.

row.entry: A service to drag from a palette to the Nav tree.
Locates the AsureID software in the local installation.
Remaining rows contain Niagara and Niagara Cloud Suite-related terms

section.title: Graphics
section.p: The following table is not used as a source for OEM graphics. Julie left it in this file just for reference purposes. These graphics are used in the Station Security Guide. The graphics key definition map is the source for these images.

fig.title: Example of an Allowed Hosts list

row.entry: Long Product name for Honeywell Forge. Formerly referred to as Honeywell Cloud, this is the full name for Forge (product Honeywell sells that stores BMS data in the cloud, analyzes the data, provides reports and a dashboards).

This refers to where the all data are stored (BMS, security, etc.). Technically, this is handled by Arm Pelion, ICS Shield Security Center and whatever else, but we don’t need to confuse users with all the technical terms that provide the seamless operation they experience.

Short Product name for Honeywell Forge
Used in Resource Center taxonomy (used in bookmeta prodinfo section of bookmaps)
Long product name for easy onboarding customer gateway device to communicate with Forge cloud.
Tridium software portal Niagara-Central.com — Term is became brandable — 15Jun20–ja
The Community area of the corporate portal; the Community side of Niagara-Central — Term is NOT brandable — 10Oct17–cn
DIY configuation application on the Dell Gateway device that walks FM user through configuring network connections during the gateway onboarding process.
Used where we want the version to change with every release of the document.
Portal (formerly Nextnine Security Center, also referred to as ICS Shield Security Center) on Honeywell Forge. For cloud-based operations performed by DigOps/AOC users

Another portal on Honeywell Forge. For setting-up Customer/Site(s) for cloud-based operations performed by CSM/AOC users. Also for registering gateway during onboarding process, customer site-based operations performed by FM users. This portal also is used to access and configure data stored in Honeywell’s cloud.
New name in 2020 for the existing Sentience/NCHSD implementation of Niagara Cloud Services platform
official EBI product name with trademark
Name used once at the beginning of the doc.
Official name for the FC preliminary tool for testing network firewall exceptions.
new product name for software virtual gateway for onboarding to forge.
new product name for on-site physical hardware gateway for onboarding to forge.

Product name with TM for first time usage. Full Product version name placeholder for OEMs that use this variable with TM. This is not Trademarked but OEM equivalents are in first use of term.Trying to make all the TMs line up so using DITA <sup> tag rather than arbrotext auto-gen sup tag.
Short version of product name. Distech always uses the full product names.
Short product version 3.5. Referred to in the AX to N4 Migration Guide. Distech always uses full product names.
Short product version 3.6. Distech always uses the full product names.
Short product update release, 3.6U4. Distech always uses full product names.
Short product version 3.7. Distech always uses full product names.
Short product version 3.7U1. Distech always uses full product names.
AX style property sheet view (eventually just N4 “Property Sheet”)
AX style slot sheet view (eventually just N4 “Property Sheet” Slot Details)
Product name: Enterprise Security (duplicating this to avoid possible broken link. Need to clean up)
Product name: Enterprise Security (this has correct ID)
